devdoc.details: Uses centralized storage via DiamondStorageLib and custom errors. Detailed Features: - Non-reentrant protection is applied via a custom modifier. - Pausable functionality is included with pause/unpause functions. - Only an admin (as defined in DiamondStorageLib) can pause or unpause the contract. - Emits detailed events on pause, unpause, and burning actions.

params.user: The address whose tokens were burned.

params.account: The address that triggered the pause.
The address that triggered the unpause.

burnJiblyPoints(uint256).details: Uses non-reentrancy and only executes when not paused.      Reverts if the amount is zero or if the caller does not have sufficient balance.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to burn.

constructor.details: Sets the reentrancy status to not entered and the contract to unpaused.

pause().details: Can only be called by the admin.

unpause().details: Can only be called by the admin.

devdoc.title: JiblycoinBurn

BurnZero().notice: Thrown when an attempt is made to burn zero tokens.

InsufficientBalance().notice: Thrown when an operation is attempted with an insufficient token balance.

JiblyPointsBurned(address,uint256).notice: Emitted when Jiblycoin points are burned.

Paused(address).notice: Emitted when the contract is paused.

Unpaused(address).notice: Emitted when the contract is unpaused.

burnJiblyPoints(uint256).notice: Burns a specified amount of Jiblycoin points.

pause().notice: Pauses the contract, disabling sensitive operations.

userdoc.notice: Implements a burning mechanism with rate limiting.

devdoc.details: Defines the main storage structure (DiamondStorage) that holds all state variables,      and provides helper functions for accessing storage and managing roles.
devdoc.title: DiamondStorageLib

userdoc.notice: Provides centralized storage for the Jiblycoin ecosystem using the diamond pattern.

devdoc.details: Using custom errors instead of revert strings provides gas savings during failed executions. Each error is documented with NatSpec to explain its purpose.
devdoc.title: Errors

Errors.metadata: {"compiler":{"version":"0.8.28+commit.7893614a"},"language":"Solidity","output":{"abi":[{"inputs":[],"name":"AlreadyClaimed","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"Blacklisted","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"BurnZero","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"CannotStakeZero","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"CircuitActive","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"ExecTimeZero","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"InsuffBal","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"InsufficientBalance","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"InsufficientStakedBalance","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"MustHoldNFT","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"NoCategory","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"NoDescription","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"OracleNotSet","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"PointsCapExceeded","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"PoolAlreadyExists","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"PoolDoesNotExist","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"RateLimitExceeded","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"TxExceedsMax","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"WalletExceedsMax","type":"error"},{"inputs":[],"name":"ZeroAddress","type":"error"}],"devdoc":{"details":"Using custom errors instead of revert strings provides gas savings during failed executions. Each error is documented with NatSpec to explain its purpose.","kind":"dev","methods":{},"title":"Errors","version":1},"userdoc":{"errors":{"AlreadyClaimed()":[{"notice":"Thrown when an action is attempted that has already been claimed."}],"Blacklisted()":[{"notice":"Thrown when an operation is attempted with a blacklisted address."}],"BurnZero()":[{"notice":"Thrown when an attempt is made to burn zero tokens."}],"CannotStakeZero()":[{"notice":"Thrown when an attempt is made to stake zero tokens."}],"CircuitActive()":[{"notice":"Thrown when a function call is attempted while the circuit breaker is active."}],"ExecTimeZero()":[{"notice":"Thrown when a provided execution time is zero."}],"InsuffBal()":[{"notice":"Thrown as an alternative insufficient balance error."}],"InsufficientBalance()":[{"notice":"Thrown when an operation is attempted with an insufficient token balance."}],"InsufficientStakedBalance()":[{"notice":"Thrown when the staked balance is insufficient for an unstaking operation."}],"MustHoldNFT()":[{"notice":"Thrown when a staking pool requires NFT ownership but the user does not hold one."}],"NoCategory()":[{"notice":"Thrown when a proposal is created without a category."}],"NoDescription()":[{"notice":"Thrown when a proposal is created without a description."}],"OracleNotSet()":[{"notice":"Thrown when an oracle required for an operation is not set."}],"PointsCapExceeded()":[{"notice":"Thrown when a reward or points cap is exceeded."}],"PoolAlreadyExists()":[{"notice":"Thrown when an attempt is made to create a staking pool that already exists."}],"PoolDoesNotExist()":[{"notice":"Thrown when a referenced staking pool does not exist."}],"RateLimitExceeded()":[{"notice":"Thrown when an operation exceeds the allowed rate limit."}],"TxExceedsMax()":[{"notice":"Thrown when a transaction amount exceeds the maximum allowed size."}],"WalletExceedsMax()":[{"notice":"Thrown when a wallet balance would exceed the maximum allowed limit."}],"ZeroAddress()":[{"notice":"Thrown when a zero address is provided where a non\u2011zero address is expected."}]},"kind":"user","methods":{},"notice":"This library defines custom errors used throughout the Jiblycoin ecosystem.","version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"c:/Users/APMG_LAdmin/Jiblycoin/contracts/libraries/Errors.sol":"Errors"},"evmVersion":"cancun","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[],"viaIR":true},"sources":{"c:/Users/APMG_LAdmin/Jiblycoin/contracts/libraries/Errors.sol":{"keccak256":"0x346fcf14a21fb50f5694b196ce65c3b1f9520e9c4e38976a6bdbb60e77addce6","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://e70c583f26b7b155402d795057f9aa2a19a7c3b1c4f0bec2ffe5cbc468b13a6b","dweb:/ipfs/QmdE4HEhYAPTTYhYQpBiBuShqK7NgR9tvG7Mh6pL7HwRVN"]}},"version":1}

AlreadyClaimed().notice: Thrown when an action is attempted that has already been claimed.

Blacklisted().notice: Thrown when an operation is attempted with a blacklisted address.

BurnZero().notice: Thrown when an attempt is made to burn zero tokens.

CannotStakeZero().notice: Thrown when an attempt is made to stake zero tokens.

CircuitActive().notice: Thrown when a function call is attempted while the circuit breaker is active.

ExecTimeZero().notice: Thrown when a provided execution time is zero.

InsuffBal().notice: Thrown as an alternative insufficient balance error.

InsufficientBalance().notice: Thrown when an operation is attempted with an insufficient token balance.

InsufficientStakedBalance().notice: Thrown when the staked balance is insufficient for an unstaking operation.

MustHoldNFT().notice: Thrown when a staking pool requires NFT ownership but the user does not hold one.

NoCategory().notice: Thrown when a proposal is created without a category.

NoDescription().notice: Thrown when a proposal is created without a description.

OracleNotSet().notice: Thrown when an oracle required for an operation is not set.

PointsCapExceeded().notice: Thrown when a reward or points cap is exceeded.

PoolAlreadyExists().notice: Thrown when an attempt is made to create a staking pool that already exists.

PoolDoesNotExist().notice: Thrown when a referenced staking pool does not exist.

RateLimitExceeded().notice: Thrown when an operation exceeds the allowed rate limit.

TxExceedsMax().notice: Thrown when a transaction amount exceeds the maximum allowed size.

WalletExceedsMax().notice: Thrown when a wallet balance would exceed the maximum allowed limit.

ZeroAddress().notice: Thrown when a zero address is provided where a non‑zero address is expected.

userdoc.notice: This library defines custom errors used throughout the Jiblycoin ecosystem.

devdoc.details: This library defines core structs and enums for fee parameters, governance, vesting,      loyalty tiers, user statistics, bridging, staking, and proposals.

userdoc.notice: Contains all data structures used in the Jiblycoin ecosystem.

documentation.text:
@notice Emitted when the contract is paused.
 @param account The address that triggered the pause.

@notice Emitted when the contract is unpaused.
 @param account The address that triggered the unpause.

@notice Initializes the burn contract.
 @dev Sets the reentrancy status to not entered and the contract to unpaused.

@notice Prevents reentrant calls to a function.
 @dev Uses a simple status check before and after function execution.
@notice Ensures that the function is executed only when the contract is not paused.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function () pure returns (struct DiamondStorageLib.DiamondStorage storage pointer)

documentation.text:
@notice Restricts access to functions to the admin wallet.
 @dev Checks that the caller matches the adminWallet defined in DiamondStorage.

@notice Pauses the contract, disabling sensitive operations.
 @dev Can only be called by the admin.

@notice Unpauses the contract, re-enabling operations.
 @dev Can only be called by the admin.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function () pure returns (struct DiamondStorageLib.DiamondStorage storage pointer)

documentation.text: @notice The unique storage slot for the DiamondStorage structure.
@notice Thrown when an attempt is made to burn zero tokens.
@notice Thrown when an operation is attempted with an insufficient token balance.
@notice Thrown as an alternative insufficient balance error.
@notice Thrown when an action is attempted that has already been claimed.
@notice Thrown when an operation exceeds the allowed rate limit.
@notice Thrown when a function call is attempted while the circuit breaker is active.
@notice Thrown when a zero address is provided where a non‑zero address is expected.

@notice Thrown when a transaction amount exceeds the maximum allowed size.
@notice Thrown when a wallet balance would exceed the maximum allowed limit.

@notice Thrown when a proposal is created without a category.
@notice Thrown when a provided execution time is zero.
@notice Thrown when a reward or points cap is exceeded.
@notice Thrown when an operation is attempted with a blacklisted address.
@notice Thrown when a referenced staking pool does not exist.
@notice Thrown when an attempt is made to stake zero tokens.
@notice Thrown when a staking pool requires NFT ownership but the user does not hold one.
@notice Thrown when the staked balance is insufficient for an unstaking operation.
@notice Thrown when an attempt is made to create a staking pool that already exists.
@notice Enumerates the available loyalty tiers for Jiblycoin holders.
